Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-center, retrospective cohort study

Participants.evidence: 652 patients undergoing elective resection of pancreatic cancer at Heidelberg University Hospital between 2009 and 2016

Intervention.evidence: divided into two groups: the high-EtCO2 group and the low-EtCO2 group

Method_Outcome.evidence: The pre-specified primary endpoint was the assessment of recurrence-free survival up to the last known follow-up

Number_Analysed.evidence: 652 patients undergoing elective resection of pancreatic cancer

Result_Outcome.evidence: Recurrence-free survival did not differ among the high and low-EtCO2 groups [HR = 1.043 (95% CI: 0.875–1.243), log rank test: p = 0.909]

Harms.evidence: Cardiovascular events, surgical site infections, sepsis, and reoperations during the hospital stay, as well as overall survival were pre-specified secondary outcomes
